body: @joel5638 tiff images are handles normally. No changes are required. For training custom data see https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

@glenn-jocher thank you. 
So im trying to train a yolov3 spp on 16 bit thermal data which has images with .tiff. So Ive gone through ultralytics way of training. It helped me great. 

So ive changed the train.txt and test.txt with .tiff entensions. 
So when im running the 

Python3 train.py  —cfg cfg/yolov3-spp-r.cfg  —weights/yolov3-spp.weights. 

It throws an error not reading those .tiff extensions. 

Im stuck here having very less resources. Can you please guide me?
@FranciscoReveriano yes i’m. Working with Flir dataset

So there is one format which says ‘.tif’   But im not sure if it should be ‘.tiff’ instead. 
But sure will try this then

@joel5638 yes, perhaps I should just add an additional format for the extension with 2 f's. It's the same format right? You can check if cv2 can open it very easily:

```python
import cv2

file = 'image.tiff'
img = cv2.imread(file)
print(img)
```

@glenn-jocher @FranciscoReveriano  Ive tried the cv2 lines to read the .tiff image which It worked fine. So, Ive added ".tiff" extension in the 
 img_formats = ['.bmp', '.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.tif', '.dng']  and tried. But it says this\

 'AssertionError: No labels found. Recommend correcting image and label paths"

But ive added the correct labels and the paths are correct

For the .tiff images. I'm using the same "labels.zip" folder for .jpg. Im using the same labels for both .jpg and .tiff
![Screenshot from 2020-02-24 09-59-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38422983/75128924-8f9e2c80-56ec-11ea-8522-b798a3540d09.png)

@joel5638 your label paths are incorrect, follow the guidelines in https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

If you want to see what the paths you supplied are, put a breakpoint there and read the values.

@joel5638 also I just noticed, you appear to be using an out of date version of this repo. If I start training I don't see any message saying 'reading labels', I see this:

```bash
$ python3 train.py --data coco64.data
Namespace(accumulate=4, adam=False, arc='default', batch_size=16, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3-spp.cfg', data='coco64.data', device='', epochs=273, evolve=False, img_size=[416], multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, rect=False, resume=False, single_cls=False, var=None, weights='weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt')
Using CPU

Caching labels (63 found, 1 missing, 0 empty, 0 duplicate, for 64 images): 100%|████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 64/64 [00:00<00:00, 6886.14it/s]
Caching labels (63 found, 1 missing, 0 empty, 0 duplicate, for 64 images): 100%|████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 64/64 [00:00<00:00, 6494.93it/s]
Model Summary: 225 layers, 6.29987e+07 parameters, 6.29987e+07 gradients
Using 8 dataloader workers
Starting training for 273 epochs...
```
